column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  June 20 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed the 'A' Issuer Default  Rating (IDR) on Mercury General Corporation (NYSE: MCY) and the 'A+' Insurer  Financial Strength (IFS) ratings on MCY's subsidiaries. Additionally  Fitch has  affirmed the 'A' IDR on MCY's subsidiary  Mercury Casualty Co.  and the 'A'  rating on Mercury Casualty's secured senior bank debt. The Rating Outlook is  Stable. A full list of rating actions follows at t

column4: Molson Coors Canada wins injunction in tussle with Miller
column5: TORONTO  June 20 The Ontario Superior Court on Thursday granted Molson Coors a temporary injunction that prevents Miller Brewing Co from ending a license agreement with Molson's  Canadian arm before a trial scheduled for December.

column4: Morgan Stanley to exit some commodities markets
column5: LONDON Morgan Stanley  will trim its commodities division by exiting areas such as trading of agricultural products  freight and some European power and gas following similar steps by other banks due to a poor outlook for revenue.

column4: Morgan Stanley to exit some commodities markets - memo
column5: LONDON  June 20 Wall Street giant Morgan Stanley  will trim its commodities unit by exiting sectors such as trading of agricultural products  freight as well as European power and gas following similar moves by rivals due to poor revenue outlook.

column4: Poland sees Kompania Weglowa joining PGE's Opole project-report
column5: WARSAW  June 20 Poland's treasury ministry would like state-owned miner Kompania Weglowa to enter an alliance with top utility PGE to help PGE build coal-fired units for a power station in the southern city of Opole  a newspaper reported on Thursday.

column4: Hurdler Pearson to return from injury next week
column5: World and Olympic champion Sally Pearson will compete in her first 100 meters hurdles event since winning gold at last year's London Games when she races in the Czech Republic next week  Athletics Australia said on Thursday.

column4: B&G Foods  Pinnacle Foods eye Unilever's Wish-Bone: sources
column5: Unilever Group's   Wish-Bone salad dressing is drawing interest from food companies B&G Foods Inc  and Pinnacle Foods Inc   according to several sources familiar with the matter.

column4: Perelman company reaches another settlement with government
column5: A company owned by Ronald Perelman has agreed to pay $720 000 to settle Department of Justice charges over a stock purchase  the second time this month that the billionaire financier agreed to penalties to resolve civil charges by the federal government.

column4: UPDATE 1-Rio Tinto to start exporting Oyu Tolgoi copper on June 21 -sources
column5: ULAN BATOR  June 20 Rio Tinto   plans to start exporting copper from the $6.2 billion Oyu Tolgoi mine in Mongolia on Friday  after resolving demands from the government  according to a new invitation received by Reuters.

column4: UPDATE 1-Fortescue says needs more time to reach infrastructure sale
column5: * Sale of port and rail assets estimated to raise up to A$4 bln

column4: Rite Aid posts third straight quarterly profit
column5: Rite Aid Corp   the No. 3 U.S. drugstore chain  posted its third consecutive quarterly profit on Thursday  helped by sales of higher-margin generic drugs.

column4: Britain faces major obstacles to RBS break-up plan
column5: LONDON Britain would face big obstacles to a break up of state-controlled Royal Bank of Scotland  and such a step might not achieve its ultimate aim of boosting lending to the economy  analysts and investors said.

column4: Britain faces major obstacles to RBS break-up plan
column5: * Assets worth up to 120 bln stg could be hived off - source

column4: BRIEF-RBS targets 9 pct core tier 1 ratio by end 2013
column5: LONDON  June 20 RBS :  * Continues to target a 'fully loaded' Basel 3 ct1 ratio of around 9% by year

column4: SandRidge ousts CEO Ward  Bennett takes the helm
column5: SandRidge Energy Inc's  board of directors removed the energy company's founder and chief executive  Tom Ward  on Wednesday after a months-long struggle with activist investors who accused him of strategic mistakes and self-dealing at the expense of shareholders.

column4: UK cost agency turns down Sanofi bowel cancer drug
column5: LONDON Sanofi's new bowel cancer drug Zaltrap is not worth using on Britain's state health service given its high price  the country's healthcare cost watchdog said on Friday.

column5: * European insurers look to offer cover against cyber threat

column4: Sony CEO asks for patience as shareholders press on spinoff plan
column5: TOKYO Sony Corp  shareholders pressed its chief executive for a response to hedge fund Third Point's proposal for a partial spinoff of its profitable entertainment arm but Kazuo Hirai pleaded for patience as management reviews the bold plan.

column4: UPDATE 3-Sony CEO asks for patience as shareholders press on spinoff plan
column5: * Shareholders press CEO Hirai for detailed stance on spinoff proposal

column4: Sony to consider Third Point's proposal: Sony CEO Hirai
column5: TOKYO Sony Corp CEO Kazuo Hirai said on Thursday that the electronics firm's board will consider hedge fund Third Point's suggestion to spin-off the electronics company's profitable entertainment arm.

column4: Sony to consider Third Point's proposal -Sony CEO Hirai
column5: TOKYO  June 20 Sony Corp CEO Kazuo Hirai said on Thursday that the electronics firm's board will consider hedge fund Third Point's suggestion to spin-off the electronics company's profitable entertainment arm.

column4: Sprint raises Clearwire bid  wins key investor support
column5: NEW YORK Sprint Nextel Corp raised its buyout offer for Clearwire Corp to $5 per share on Thursday and announced support from a key group of dissident shareholders  likely ending a bitter battle with rival suitor Dish Network Corp.

column4: UPDATE 3-Sprint raises Clearwire bid  wins key investor support

column4: CORRECTED-Sprint raises its offer for Clearwire to $5/share
column5: NEW YORK  June 20 Sprint Nextel Corp  raised its buyout offer for Clearwire Corp to $5 per share on Thursday  trumping a $4.40 per share offer from Dish Network Corp.

column4: RLPC: Gannett to launch $1.25B credit for Belo buy
column5: NEW YORK  June 20 Media and marketing solutions company Gannett Co is expected to launch next week general syndication of a $1.25 billion pro rata package backing its acquisition of television company Belo Corp  sources told Thomson Reuters LPC.

column4: Blackstone settles Extended Stay lawsuit for $10 million
column5: Blackstone Group LP  agreed to pay $10 million to settle a lawsuit that had sought $8.4 billion for its role in the sale and subsequent bankruptcy of hotel chain Extended Stay Inc.

column4: Exclusive: Banks vie to run Wal-Mart's coveted $15 billion retirement plan
column5: Wal-Mart Stores Inc is considering bids from retirement plan managers to run its $15.6 billion 401(k) program  which has been administered by Bank of America's Merrill Lynch unit for 15 years  according to three sources familiar with the situation.
